poem:
Title: "A Lament for Modern Courtship"

Wealth whispers in a thousand videos—
"Trust fund, stature, eyes of sky."
Yet not in a bank, nor 'mid crystal chandeliers,
does the heart's ledger comply.

Seek not for gold in a beggar's words
nor love in a rich man's verse,
For purest passion is a common bird
that in simple nests converses.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Young women are telling each other to ‘date rich’. How terrifyingly retro | Emma Beddington ‘I’m looking for a man in finance” goes the viral TikTok song of the summer. And it doesn’t mean my version – standing in the only bank branch for miles that hasn’t become a Costa, looking for someone, anyone, with a lanyard, a tablet and a can-do attitude to sort out my direct debit problem. “Trust fund, 6’5”, blue eyes,”". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
